contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2013}} {{Use Australian English|date=May 2013}} {{Infobox airport | name = Geelong Airport | nativename = | nativename-a = | nativename-r = | image = | image-width = | caption = | IATA = <s>GEX</s> | ICAO = <s>YGLG</s> | type = Public | owner = | operator = | city-served = Geelong | location = [[Grovedale, Victoria|Grovedale]] | elevation-f = 140 | latd = 38 | latm = 13 | lats = 31 | latNS = S | longd= 144 | longm= 19 | longs= 59 | longEW= E | coordinates_region = AU-VIC | pushpin_map = Australia Victoria | pushpin_label = YGLG | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Victoria | website = | metric-rwy = Yes | r1-number =<s>09/27</s> | r1-length-m = | r1-surface = <s>Gravel</s> | r2-number = <s>18/36</s> | r2-length-m = | r2-surface = <s>Asphalt</s> | stat-year = | stat1-header = | stat1-data = | stat2-header = | stat2-data = | footnotes = Reference<ref>[http://gc.kls2.com/airport/YGLG Great Circle Mapper: YGLG - Geelong, Victoria, Australia]</ref>{{AIP AU|YGLG|name=Perth}} }} '''Geelong Airport''' <s>{{airport codes|GEX|YGLG}}</s> was a small airfield specifically for light aircraft located in [[Mount Duneed, Victoria|Mount Duneed]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], Australia. It was primarily used for scenic flights and private aircraft, and was located in the [[Local government in Australia|local government area]] of the [[City of Greater Geelong]]. The airport remained small and undeveloped and contained two gravel/tarmac [[runway]]s: north/south and east/west. Though commercial airlines had attempted to fly services to Geelong in the past, they chose to use the more developed airport at [[Avalon Airport]], located to the north on the [[Melbourne]] side of the city. Other airports in the area are at [[Barwon Heads Airport|Barwon Heads]] {{airport codes||YBRS}} and the [[Torquay Airport]] {{airport codes||YTQY}} in Blackgate Road, Torquay. The site is also used to record wind and weather measurements for the area.<ref>[http://www.bom.gov.au/climate/averages/tables/cw_087163.shtml Bureau of Meteorology: Summary statistics GEELONG AIRPORT]</ref> Geelong airport was sold to property developers to allow for the expansion of the [[urban sprawl]] of Geelong. The airport closed 31 December 2011.<ref>[http://www.geelongcity.vic.gov.au/Services_In_Geelong/Planning/Strategic_Planning/Armstrong_Creek_Urban_Growth_Plan/ City of Greater Geelong: Armstrong Creek Urban Growth Plan]{{Dead link|date=July 2012}}</ref> ==See also== {{Portal|Victoria}} * [[List of airports in Victoria (Australia)|List of airports in Victoria]] * [[Transportation in Australia]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Airports in Victoria (Australia)}} [[Category:Transport in Geelong]] [[Category:Defunct airports in Victoria (Australia)]] {{Australia-airport-stub}}
